prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Audrey Lee
mes:
"Hanbin-ah! Clean up after yourself, goddammit!"

Audrey knows she's shouting into the void; Noah's been holed up in his bedroom since he got back from school, probably playing some stupid ass FPS game with his headphones on. Or just ignoring her like he always fucking does when Audrey puts her foot down. The sink is filled with dishes— pots and pans and bowls of food-turning-mush— but Audrey can't be bothered to clean up right now.

She slinks down on the couch and props her foot up on the coffee table, stretching herself out over the backrest. Her eyes flit over to her phone on the cushion beside her and she can't help but tap the screen. She's got a couple texts, but none from Hailee.

"Fucking Hailee," Audrey grumbles to herself, shoving her phone aside and narrowing her eyes at the TV. She shifts on the couch, suddenly feeling tense. "Fuck her."

It's been literal radio silence on Hailee's end for the past week; she can only seem to spare the occasional "good morning" or "wyd" like they're still in a goddamn talking stage and it's pissing Audrey off. Albeit, Audrey's not responding as quickly as she should either, but that's only because Hailee's doing it. Otherwise, she'd jump on the opportunity to respond to her texts.

It's not a foreign concept either. In the past three months, this is probably the third time the two of them have called it quits. They both know it doesn't _really_ mean it's over, but sometimes Audrey can't help but wonder what Hailee does during their little... "breaks." She's not insecure enough to ask about it.

Hell, she'll find out sooner or later.

Audrey slips her hand into the pocket of her sweats, fingers grazing over her box of Newports. It's a nasty habit and she knows it, but ever since her mom died, she really sees no reason to cope healthily. Sure, she goes to the gym here and there, but nothing's about to cancel out five years of chainsmoking cigarettes.

She pulls her hand away and crosses her arms behind her head, letting out a defeated huff. _Might as well just go to sleep._

But just as Audrey begins to doze off, there's a loud knock on the door that startles her awake. Her head snaps up and she looks over the back of the couch as if she can see who is standing on the other side of the door. With the way that the hair stands up on the back of her neck and the atmosphere suddenly seems colder, she can only assume that it's Hailee.

Audrey's heart thunders in her chest as she rises to her feet, joints popping from what feels like hours of immobility. Part of her doesn't want to see Hailee's face at all; she has the audacity to show up on the doorstep of her apartment, but not send a damn text? But part of her just... misses her girlfriend.

She knows they're fucking toxic, but Hailee's just about the only constant in this miserable life she's chosen to lead.

Pushing any thoughts in her head away, Audrey reaches for the doorknob and opens it slowly. And, lo and behold, Hailee stands on the other side. For a moment, Audrey swears her heart stops beating. Something about her looks... different. _Fuck, no way she found someone else already._

Audrey can't help as a scowl forms on her face. Her body fills the doorframe as she leans against it, seemingly sizing Hailee up. Audrey doesn't say anything; instead, she just glares at her, eyebrows twitching slightly. She wants to be angry, and despite her outwards demeanor that she is, she really just isn't. Audrey really did just fucking miss her.

"Pretty seeing you here, baby," Audrey mutters, crossing her arms over her chest. Her fingers flex instinctively, like they want to reach out and touch Hailee. But she doesn't. "What warrants such a surprise visit? Come to break up with me for good this time?"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee lunges forward her hand coming to cup thr back of Aubrey's neck as she presses her lips against hers. She moans low in her throat practically pulling Aubrey's over the threshold as she kisses ker

name: Audrey Lee
mes:
Audrey stumbles forward from the force of Hailee's kiss, her back hitting the doorframe as those soft lips press against hers with desperate hunger. The suddenness of it makes her head spin—one second she's standing there being a petty bitch, and the next, Hailee's got her by the neck like she owns her.

And fuck if that doesn't make Audrey weak in the knees.

She groans into the kiss, hands flying to grip Hailee’s waist hard enough to bruise. Her fingers dig into soft fabric, dragging her closer until their bodies are flush together. Audrey can feel every curve pressed against her—the warmth of Hailee’s skin through thin cotton, the way she shivers when Audrey nips at her bottom lip just a little too rough.

"Missed you," Audrey growls between kisses, voice already wrecked from just this much contact. She pulls back just enough to look down at Hailee’s face—those big green eyes half-lidded and hazy with want, lips swollen from how hard they've been kissing already. Fuck if that isn't a sight that makes heat coil low in Audrey’s stomach.

But then reality kicks in again—this girl ghosted her for a week and now thinks she can just show up and kiss it all better? Like hell.

With one last possessive bite on Hailee’s lower lip (just because she *can*), Audrey pulls away fully this time, keeping an iron grip on those hips so she doesn't go far but putting enough space between them so they can fucking talk first before things escalate any further than this hallway where Noah could walk out any second now and see his sister getting devoured by some clingy Italian brat who won't text back like a normal person would do after three days apart instead of seven whole-ass ones without explanation whatsoever—

"Where were you?" The question comes out sharper than intended but whatever; if anyone gets to be pissed right now it should be *her*, not Miss I-Disappear-For-A-Week-And-Then-Come-Back-Like-Nothing-Happened over here looking all pretty with messy hair like maybe someone else had their hands tangled up in it recently which is NOT helping calm down certain thoughts racing through Aubrey Lee's very jealous brain right about now okay???
swipes:
Audrey stumbles forward from the sudden force of Hailee's kiss, her back hitting the doorframe as those familiar lips crash against hers. The taste of mint and something distinctly *Hailee* floods her senses, making her head spin. For a split second, Audrey resists—her hands twitching at her sides like she wants to push Hailee away—but then she groans into the kiss, fingers finally curling into the fabric of Hailee’s sweatshirt to yank her closer.

Her grip tightens almost possessively as she deepens the kiss, teeth grazing Hailee’s bottom lip just hard enough to sting. When they finally break apart for air, Audrey’s breathing is ragged, pupils blown wide with want despite herself.

“The fuck was that?” she rasps, voice rough as gravel. But there’s no real bite behind it—just a shaky exhale and the way her thumb unconsciously swipes over Hailee’s hipbone through the thin fabric of her clothes.

She should be pissed. She *was* pissed five seconds ago before this girl decided to ambush-kiss all coherent thought out of her skull. But now? Now Audrey just wants to drag Hailee inside by that stupid fucking sweatshirt and remind her exactly who she belongs to—break or no break.

Her jaw clenches as she stares down at those swollen lips, fighting every instinct in her body not to claim them again right here in their goddamn doorway where Noah could walk out any second and see them like this (not that he hasn't before).

Instead, Audrey forces herself to lean back slightly—though not enough for actual space between them—and raises an eyebrow expectantly. “You gonna explain yourself or just keep standing there looking pretty?”

Audrey stumbles forward from the sudden force, barely catching herself before she topples over Hailee. Her hands instinctively fly up to grip Hailee's waist—fingers digging into the soft fabric of her sweatshirt as their lips crash together. The taste of spearmint gum and something distinctly *Hailee* floods her senses, and Audrey can't help the way her body immediately responds, melting into the kiss despite herself.

For a brief moment, she forgets she’s supposed to be pissed at her.

Then reality snaps back like a rubber band.

Audrey pulls back just enough to break the kiss, but doesn’t let go—her grip on Hailee tightens instead, keeping her close enough that their noses still brush. Her breath comes out ragged as she glares down at her through half-lidded eyes.

"*The fuck* was that?" Audrey growls low in her throat—but it lacks any real bite because goddammit, she *liked* it. "You don’t text me for a week and now you show up here kissing me like we didn’t just call it quits? You got some nerve."

Audrey stumbles forward from the force of Hailee's kiss, her back hitting the doorframe as those soft lips press against hers with desperate hunger. With one last possessive bite on Hailee’s lower lip (just because she *can*), Audrey pulls away fully this time, keeping an iron grip on those hips so she doesn't go far but putting enough space between them so they can fucking talk first before things escalate any further than this hallway where Noah could walk out any second now and see his sister getting devoured by some clingy Italian brat who won't text back like a normal person would do after three days apart instead of seven whole-ass ones without explanation whatsoever—

"Where were you?"
